definition: to be cleanable, completely, free of drugs, a weightlift in which the barbell is lifted to shoulder height and then jerked overhead
details:
verb
- to be cleanable
= example: to be cleanable
- to remove unwanted substances from
= synonyms: scavenge
- to remove while making clean
- to make clean by removing dirt, filth, or unwanted substances from
= synonyms: make clean
- to clean and tidy up the house
= example: to clean and tidy up the house
= synonyms: houseclean, clean house
- to remove all contents or possession from, or empty completely
= example: to remove all contents or possession from, or empty completely
= synonyms: strip
- to deprive wholly of money in a gambling game, robbery, etc
= example: to deprive wholly of money in a gambling game, robbery, etc
- to clean one's body or parts thereof, as by washing
= example: to clean one's body or parts thereof, as by washing
= synonyms: cleanse
- to remove unwanted substances from, such as feathers or pits
= example: to remove unwanted substances from, such as feathers or pits
= synonyms: pick
- to remove shells or husks from
= example: to remove shells or husks from
adverb
- completely
= synonyms: plumb
- in conformity with the rules or laws and without fraud or cheating
= synonyms: fairly
adjective
- free of drugs
= example: free of drugs
- free from clumsiness
= synonyms: neat
- not carrying concealed weapons
- free from dirt or impurities
= example: free from dirt or impurities
- (of behavior or especially language) free from objectionable elements
= synonyms: unobjectionable
- not spreading pollution or contamination
= synonyms: uncontaminating
- ritually clean or pure
- thorough and without qualification
= example: thorough and without qualification
- without difficulties or problems
= example: without difficulties or problems
- exhibiting or calling for sportsmanship or fair play
= example: exhibiting or calling for sportsmanship or fair play
= synonyms: sporty
- (of a surface) not written or printed on
= synonyms: white
- (of a manuscript) having few alterations or corrections
= synonyms: fair
- morally pure
= example: morally pure
= synonyms: clean-living
- of a record, having no marks of discredit or offense
= example: of a record, having no marks of discredit or offense
- free from impurities
= example: free from impurities
= synonyms: fine
- (of sound or color) free from anything that dulls or dims
= example: (of sound or color) free from anything that dulls or dims
= synonyms: clear
- free of restrictions or qualifications
= example: free of restrictions or qualifications
= synonyms: clear
- free from sepsis or infection
= example: free from sepsis or infection
= synonyms: uninfected
noun
- a weightlift in which the barbell is lifted to shoulder height and then jerked overhead
= synonyms: clean and jerk
